comprise.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to consist of particular parts, groups etc
comprise.translation[0].definitions[0].e: The house comprises two bedrooms, a kitchen, and a living room.
The committee is comprised of well-known mountaineers.
comprise.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to form part of a larger group of people or things
comprise.translation[0].definitions[1].e: Women comprise a high proportion of part-time workers.
comprise.translation[0].note_box[0].item: Comprise is not used in the progressive You say
The exam is comprising four questions
The participle form comprising is often used
Food exports are very important, comprising 74% of the total
Comprise is often used in the passive with of
The organization is comprised of four parts
The organization comprises of four parts
